result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Instructions on how to appear remotely

11:35 AM Defendant Jacob J. Bickford appeared by Zoom video.  Attorney Caroline Ann Carver appeared by Zoom Audio for Jacob J. Bickford.  Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Calling 22cf65 and 22cf132.
Schiek statement to status of cases - offer made last week.  Defense is requesting additional time to confirm with her Client . Request plea/sentencing date. 
Bail continued in both cases.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
to appear remotely
to Appear Remotely
to appear remotely

10:03 AM Defendant Jacob J. Bickford in court. Attorney Caroline Ann Carver appeared telephonically for Jacob J. Bickford. Attorney Michael William Schiek in court for State of Wisconsin. Calling 22CF65 & 22CF132. Carver states needs to be appointed in 22CF132 - will file written waiver once appointed. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Schiek states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Carver willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Schiek statement to process of pre-trials in Oneida County and provides office phone number for Carver to contact. Bond continued. adj. 10:11 AM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.
on Request to Appear Remotely
to appear remotely

2:10 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jacob J. Bickford appeared by video. Attorney Caroline Ann Carver appeared telephonically for Jacob J. Bickford. Calling 22CF65 & 22CF132. Carver states she is appointed to 22CF65 but would like to set both cases for a preliminary hearing. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing - time limits waived. Bail continued. adj. 02:38 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:53 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob J. Bickford in court. 
Calling 22cf132 and 22cf65 - Attorney Caroline Carver represents on 22cf65- was on zoom earlier - but defendant was late- gives statement.
Bail continued - Court will adj - defendant to contact PD
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
notified Jack, ONSO - made VA (remanded)

1:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jacob J. Bickford in court. Court review of case - quashes warrant. Court questions Defendant on non-appearance. Defendant states police were at his house all day and was detained - not arrested. Schiek statement to bond. Defendant states still trying to apply for PD - trying to get into treatment program. Court reinstates  cash bond - bond was forfeited and needs to repost. Defendant is remanded. adj. 01:49 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:30 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jacob J. Bickford not in court. Court review of case. Pfeifer has not had contact. Court authorizes warrant. adj. 01:32 PM
Public Defender Status of Counsel Report
notified Jack, ONSO - VA

1:50 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jacob J. Bickford in court. Court review of case. Court question Defendant on non-appearance. Defendant states was released from Hospital - was going through withdrawals. Defendant statement to non-appearance. Defendant statement to PD. Court will set out. Court continues bond.  adj.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
